draw.overall_supervision_plan: Live Fire Exercise OIC/RSOs provide oversight and supervision over the ranges, making sure the all operations follow the appropriate safety precautions. The Tactical OPORDs and CONOPs will reflect a scenario supporting safe targetry and restrictive DFCMS. On PLT LFX Range, the TU conducts TEWT, one blank iteration prior to executing the Live Fire Exercise (Day and Night). This is key so that all Safeties, TSP and TU participants understand what happens on each range and to look for anything that is unsafe. Training Support Personnel (TSP) refers to any person or persons that facilitate the TU training objectives (Apache, Bull, Comanche Troop Safeties, 1/2CR Safeties). TSP acts as additional lane safeties with PTT radio communication, if available, to the RSO during dismounted and mounted movement.  Each Range has an RSO and constant access to the range tower radio and telephone to contact the Range Control Firing Desk and 7ATC as appropriate. In the event of a real world MEDEVAC event on site, Safeties and Training Support Personnel are responsible for ceasing fire on the range and communicating directly with the OIC/RSO of the range to coordinate MEDEVAC. SUAS Master Trainer will be present during SUAS Operations.
